Class GameController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Model.GameControl.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class GameController extends Object implements Serializable
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • game

      protected final Game game
      Represents the current game instance managed by the GameController. This variable is immutable and serves as the main point of interaction for the game logic and associated operations handled by the GameController.

    • eventBus

      protected final EventBus eventBus
      Manages the communication and events within the game controller. The eventBus is utilized to publish and subscribe to game-related events, facilitating interaction between components and listeners. This variable is declared as final to ensure it remains constant throughout the lifecycle of the GameController. Used by various methods to post events related to gameplay actions or system updates.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController(Game game, EventBus eventBus)
      Constructs a new GameController object with the specified game instance and event bus.
      Parameters:
      game - the instance of the Game associated with this controller
      eventBus - the EventBus used to handle and propagate events within the game

  • Method Details

    • getGame

      public Game getGame()
      Retrieves the current instance of the game being managed by the GameController.
      Returns:
      the current Game instance.

    • JoinGame

      public void JoinGame(String NickName, int NumOfPlayers)
      Allows a player to join the game by providing a nickname and the number of players participating. The method synchronizes on the game object, executes the join operation on the game's state, and handles any exceptions that may occur during the process.
      Parameters:
      NickName - the nickname of the player joining the game
      NumOfPlayers - the total number of players participating in the game

    • activateTimer

      public void activateTimer(Player player)
      Activates a timer for the given player within the game's state.
      Parameters:
      player - the player for whom the timer should be activated

    • setNumTile

      public void setNumTile(int playerid, int posTile)
      Sets the specified tile number for the player and completes the building phase. This method synchronizes on the game instance to ensure thread safety and attempts to set the tile number for the given player. If an error occurs during this process, it handles exceptions by notifying errors through the event bus.
      Parameters:
      playerid - the identifier of the player for whom the tile is being set
      posTile - the position or number of the tile to set for the player
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an unexpected error occurs during processing

    • CommandFillTile

      public void CommandFillTile(int playerid, boolean wantalien, AlienColor color, int row, int column)
      Executes the "fill tile" command for the specified player, optionally using an alien of a specific color, at the specified tile location (row and column). This method ensures game state updates and handles errors that may occur during execution.
      Parameters:
      playerid - the unique identifier of the player performing the action
      wantalien - a boolean indicating whether the player wants to involve an alien in the action
      color - the color of the alien to be used (if wantalien is true)
      row - the row position of the tile to fill
      column - the column position of the tile to fill

    • Surrend

      public void Surrend(int playerID)
      Allows a player to surrender from the game. This method synchronizes on the game object to ensure thread safety while accessing the game state and related mechanisms. If an error occurs during the surrender process, it handles exceptions by notifying the event bus of the error.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player who wants to surrender

    • visualizeFinalScores

      public HashMap<String,Float> visualizeFinalScores()
      Provides the final scores of the game by retrieving and visualizing them from the game state. Handles any runtime exceptions that may occur during the process by logging the error and triggering an error notification through the event bus. If an additional failure occurs during error handling, it rethrows the exception as a RuntimeException.
      Returns:
      a HashMap where keys are player identifiers as String and values are their corresponding scores represented as Float. Returns null if an exception prevents the scores from being retrieved.

    • pickTileAlreadyFlipped

      public void pickTileAlreadyFlipped(int index, int playerID) throws Exception
      Handles the selection of a tile that has already been flipped in the game. Updates the game state and handles any game-related errors during the operation.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the tile to select
      playerID - the ID of the player making the selection
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the process

    • pickTileUnknown

      public void pickTileUnknown(int playerID) throws Exception
      Allows a player to pick an unknown tile in the game. The method interacts with the game's current state to perform the tile selection for the specified player. This action is synchronized on the game object to ensure thread safety during execution. It handles potential exceptions that may occur during the tile-picking process.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player attempting to pick a tile
      Throws:
      Exception - if an underlying error occurs during the tile-picking process

    • pickLittleDeck

      public void pickLittleDeck(int index, int playerID) throws Exception
      Allows a player to pick a little deck in the game by specifying the deck index and the player's ID. Ensures thread-safety by synchronizing on the game object. Handles potential errors that may occur during the operation by logging and handling exceptions properly.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the little deck to be picked
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player attempting to pick the little deck
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the operation, including runtime, remote, or internal exceptions

    • depositLittleDeck

      public void depositLittleDeck(int playerID) throws Exception
      Handles the deposit of the little deck for a specific player. Ensures thread-safe execution while interacting with the game state. If any runtime or remote exceptions occur, they are properly logged and handled.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the identifier of the player depositing the little deck
      Throws:
      Exception - if any errors occur during the deposit process

    • depositTile

      public void depositTile(int playerID) throws Exception
      Executes the deposit tile action for the specified player. This method interacts with the game state to allow a player to deposit a tile during the game. It also handles errors that may occur in the process.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player performing the action
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the deposit tile process

    • endbuilding

      public void endbuilding(int PlayerID, int positionwheretogo)
      Ends the building phase for a specific player and navigates to the specified position.
      Parameters:
      PlayerID - the identifier of the player ending the building phase
      positionwheretogo - the position to navigate to after ending the building phase

    • insertTile

      public void insertTile(int row, int col, int playerID, int rotation) throws Exception
      Inserts a tile into the game state at the specified position with the given rotation and player ID. This method is synchronized to ensure thread safety when interacting with the game state. Handles exceptions by notifying an error event through the event bus.
      Parameters:
      row - The row where the tile is to be inserted.
      col - The column where the tile is to be inserted.
      playerID - The ID of the player attempting to insert the tile.
      rotation - The rotation state of the tile to be inserted.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an unforeseen issue occurs during the insertion or error notification handling.

    • EffectActivation

      public void EffectActivation()
      Activates the effect processing in the current game state. This method retrieves the current game state and attempts to activate its effect. If a runtime exception occurs during the activation process, an error message is printed to the console and the event bus is notified of the error. If any error arises in the event notification step, a RuntimeException is thrown. The method ensures thread-safety by synchronizing on the shared game object. Throws an unchecked RuntimeException in cases where an unexpected exception occurs during the invocation or error handling process.

    • getCardinuse

      public Card getCardinuse()
      Retrieves the currently active card being used in the game. This method ensures thread safety by synchronizing on the game instance. If an error occurs while accessing the card, it logs the error message and notifies the event bus about the error.
      Returns:
      the active card in use, or null if an error occurs during retrieval

    • chooseOneSubShip

      public void chooseOneSubShip(int index, int playerID)
      Selects one sub-ship based on the given index and player ID. This method ensures thread safety by synchronizing access to the game's state. If an error occurs during the selection process, it handles the exception and attempts to notify listeners of the error via the event bus.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the sub-ship to choose
      playerID - the ID of the player making the selection

    • acceptToLandOnAPlanet

      public void acceptToLandOnAPlanet(Player p, boolean yOn, int NumPlanet)
      Handles the player's request to land on a specific planet in the game. Checks if the player's action is allowed and processes the request accordingly.
      Parameters:
      p - The player requesting to land on a planet.
      yOn - A boolean indicating whether the player accepts certain conditions for landing on the planet.
      NumPlanet - The number identifying the planet the player wants to land on.

    • chooseAbandonedStation

      public void chooseAbandonedStation(Player player, FlightBoard flightBoard, boolean yOn, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> storageTiles, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> newGoods)
      Handles the selection of an abandoned station by a player during the game.
      Parameters:
      player - The player making the selection.
      flightBoard - The flight board object that tracks the game's flight data.
      yOn - A boolean value indicating a specific game state or condition.
      storageTiles - A 2D list representing the arrangement of storage tiles.
      newGoods - A 2D list representing the new goods available for placement on the storage tiles.

    • chooseCannonBatteryPos

      public void chooseCannonBatteryPos(FlightBoard fb, Player player, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> cannonPos, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> batteriesPos)
      Handles the selection of cannon and battery positions on the flight board for a specific player during the game. If the player is blocked, their input is rejected. Any exceptions encountered are logged and managed appropriately.
      Parameters:
      fb - the flight board where positions are to be chosen
      player - the player making the decision
      cannonPos - a list of positions for placing cannons
      batteriesPos - a list of positions for placing batteries

    • chooseHowToFaceMeteors

      public void chooseHowToFaceMeteors(Player player, ArrayList<Integer> howToDefenceFromShots, FlightBoard flightBoard)
      Handles the logic for a player to choose how to respond to incoming meteors during the game. If the player is blocked, an error is reported through the eventBus. Otherwise, the game state processes the player's defense actions.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is making the choice on how to face the meteors.
      howToDefenceFromShots - A list of integers representing the player's selected defenses against the meteors.
      flightBoard - The flight board that provides context for the defense choices during the game.

    • choosePassengersToLose

      public void choosePassengersToLose(Player p, boolean yOn, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> pass, FlightBoard flightBoard)
      Facilitates the process of selecting the passengers to remove or lose based on the game state and player input. This method ensures thread safety while interacting with the underlying game system and handles any errors that may occur during operation.
      Parameters:
      p - The player attempting to choose passengers to lose.
      yOn - A boolean indicating a specific condition related to the passenger selection process.
      pass - A nested list of integers representing the passengers to be selected or affected.
      flightBoard - The current state of the flight board used in the decision-making process.

    • chooseToClaimReward

      public void chooseToClaimReward(boolean yOn, Player player)
      Handles the player's decision to claim a reward during the game. If the player is blocked, the method sends a wrong input event. Otherwise, it delegates the reward processing to the game state.
      Parameters:
      yOn - a boolean flag indicating whether the player wants to claim the reward (true) or not (false)
      player - the player who is making the choice to claim the reward

    • chooseToClaimReward

      public void chooseToClaimReward(FlightBoard fb, boolean yOn, Player player, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> storageTiles, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> newGoods)
      Allows a player to claim a reward during the game by interacting with the given flight board and updating their storage tiles and collection of goods. This process is synchronized to ensure thread safety.
      Parameters:
      fb - the flight board used to determine the context of the reward claim.
      yOn - boolean indicating whether a specific condition is active during the claim.
      player - the player attempting to claim the reward.
      storageTiles - a list of lists representing the player's storage tiles affected by the claim.
      newGoods - a list of lists representing the goods to be added to the player's inventory.

    • chooseToPlaceBatteries

      public void chooseToPlaceBatteries(Player p, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> posBatAndNumBattXPos)
      Allows the player to choose positions to place batteries during the gameplay. If the player is blocked, an incorrect input event is triggered. On valid input, the game state is updated with the chosen battery positions. Handles runtime exceptions and notifies errors through the event bus if they occur.
      Parameters:
      p - The player making the battery placement decision.
      posBatAndNumBattXPos - A nested list of integers containing positions of batteries and corresponding number of batteries to be placed.

    • chooseToStartFirePower

      public void chooseToStartFirePower(Player p, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> DoubFireTriplets, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> BatteriesToAct)
      Allows the player to initiate the firing power process by specifying the required parameters for double fire triplets and the batteries to be activated.
      Parameters:
      p - the player who is attempting to start the firepower process
      DoubFireTriplets - a nested list of integers representing the double fire triplets configurations chosen by the player
      BatteriesToAct - a nested list of integers representing the positions of the batteries that the player wants to activate

    • chooseToStartMotor

      public void chooseToStartMotor(Player player, FlightBoard flightBoard, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> enginesPos, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> batteriesPos)
      Allows the specified player to choose to start the motor during the game. This action involves specifying positions for engines and batteries.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is selecting to start the motor.
      flightBoard - The flight board on which the game is being played.
      enginesPos - A list of positions representing the engine placements.
      batteriesPos - A list of positions representing the battery placements.

    • chooseWhereToPutGoods

      public void chooseWhereToPutGoods(Player player, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> posGoods, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> goodsSets)
      Handles the selection of where to place goods for a player in the game. Invokes the appropriate game state logic or notifies the event bus in case of invalid inputs. Synchronizes on the game instance to ensure thread safety.
      Parameters:
      player - the player who is choosing where to place the goods
      posGoods - the positions where the goods are to be placed, represented as nested lists of integers
      goodsSets - the sets of goods being placed, represented as nested lists of goods objects

    • insertWaitTile

      public void insertWaitTile(int playerID, int index, int row, int col, int rotation) throws Exception
      Inserts a wait tile for a specific player at the specified position with a given rotation. The action is performed in a synchronized block for thread safety and includes error handling.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the ID of the player for whom the tile is being inserted
      index - the index of the tile to be inserted
      row - the row position where the tile should be placed
      col - the column position where the tile should be placed
      rotation - the rotation of the tile (e.g., 0, 90, 180, or 270 degrees)
      Throws:
      Exception - if any error occurs during the tile insertion or event notification

    • addWaitTile

      public void addWaitTile(int playerID) throws Exception
      Adds a wait tile for the specified player in the game's state. This method ensures thread safety by synchronizing on the game object. If an error occurs during the process, it handles the error by logging the exception and notifying an event bus about the error condition.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player for whom the wait tile is to be added
      Throws:
      Exception - if an unrecoverable error occurs while adding the wait tile

    • demoGame

      public void demoGame()
      Demonstrates the state or gameplay of the current game object. This method synchronizes on the game object to ensure that the game state is accessed in a thread-safe manner. It performs the demo operation on the game state and handles runtime exceptions or other exceptions that may occur during this process. If a RuntimeException occurs, it logs the error message to the console and notifies the event bus of the error. If any exception is thrown during this notification, it is rethrown as a RuntimeException. Any other exceptions that occur are also wrapped and rethrown as RuntimeExceptions.
